title: Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2021 that review various aspects of Natural Language Processing (NLP) research. These articles cover a range of topics including foundational concepts, recent advancements, evaluation methods, and specific applications
**"A Survey of the State of the Art in Natural Language Generation: Core tasks, applications and evaluation"** by Anya Belz, Albert Gatt, Ehud Reiter, and Sharid Loáiciga
**"Pre-trained Models for Natural Language Processing: A Survey"** by Qiang Liu, Hanmeng Liu, and Jiawei Han
**"A Survey of the Usages of Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing"** by Yoav Goldberg
**"Recent Trends in Deep Learning Based Natural Language Processing"** by Ruder
**"A Survey on Text Classification: From Shallow to Deep Learning"** by X
**"A Survey on Evaluation Methods for Dialogue Systems"** by Deriu, Jan, et al
**"A Survey on Recent Advances in Named Entity Recognition from Deep Learning models"** by Yadav
**"A Survey of Recent Advances in Hierarchical Text Classification"** by Kowsari, Kamran, et al
**"A Survey on Open Information Extraction"** by Niklaus, Christina, et al
**"A Survey of Cross-lingual Word Embedding Models"** by Ruder

author.particle: on Biomedical Named Entity Recognition" by

title: **"A Survey of Deep Learning Methods for Relation Extraction"** by Yao, Linyong, et al
**"A Survey on Sentiment Analysis: Recent Developments and Challenges"** by Medhat
**"A Survey on Stance Detection for Mis- and Disinformation Identification"** by Hardalov, Momchil, et al
**"A Survey on Transfer Learning in Natural Language Processing"** by Ruder, Sebastian, et al
**"A Survey on Deep Learning for Named Entity Recognition"** by Li, Fei, et al
**"A Survey of Natural Language Generation Techniques with a Focus on Dialogue Systems – Past, Present and Future Directions"** by Gao, Jianfeng, et al

container-title: **"A Survey on Recent Advances in Neural Machine Translation"** by Bahdanau, Dzmitry, et al

title: These articles provide comprehensive overviews of their respective topics and are a great starting point for anyone looking to understand the current state and future directions of NLP research
